Test failure due to eth1-midplane rule change was fixed in https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/7764, does your testing include this PR?

Hi @SuvarnaMeenakshi, yes our test includes the fix from https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/7764, but that PR only adds the first of the two rules added in https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/42:

`allow_internal_chassis_midplane_traffic.append(['iptables', '-A', 'INPUT', '-s', chassis_midplane_ip, '-d', chassis_midplane_ip, '-j', 'ACCEPT'])
 allow_internal_chassis_midplane_traffic.append(['iptables', '-A', 'INPUT', '-i', 'eth1-midplane', '-j', 'ACCEPT'])`
 
I am adding the second one in this PR.
LGTM

Sorry, I don't understand why we call the fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` for all topology. The fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` was introduced by PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/6006. It's mainly for dualtor active-active mode. If the fixture is updated somehow, I'm afraid there would be a bunch of test failure.
Add @lolyu for comments.

Please see if that is fine > > > > > > Sorry, I don't understand why we call the fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` for all topology. The fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` was introduced by PR #6006. It's mainly for dualtor active-active mode. If the fixture is updated somehow, I'm afraid there would be a bunch of test failure. Add @lolyu for comments. > > @bingwang-ms there was code duplication in both of this API. I am calling like this now. will this not work ? > > It's hard to say. The code of `ptf_test_port_map` and `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` are not exactly the same. The fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` is for dualtor active-active mode. I don't know if it can work on other topology. Another concern is, if the fixture `ptf_test_port_map_active_active` is updated to accommodate the dualtor active-active change, we may see regressions in other topology. thanks @bingwang-ms i reverted the change.

@ppikh is having 2 auto techsupport running a valid scenario? Shouldn't it be fixed by auto tech support feature from the image side?

Hi @yxieca 2 techsupports at the same time is not a valid scenario.
But tehcsupport logic is implemented in a way - that in the case when techsupport is already running and a new one is triggered - it will start a new techsupport process which will check if techsupport is already running and will exit. Usually on non-ARM CPUs it happens immediately, but on DPU devices with ARM CPU it takes some time, and in result, we can see 2 techsupport processes running(one process doing a real dump and one just checking if techsupport already running and it will exit in few sec).

To have test passing on DPU devices with ARM CPU we need this fix, in addition we have in-test validation which will check that only one dump was generated, and in the case when 2 dumps were generated - it will fail the test case.
